meanings.definition: Capable of being put into action or carried out.
meanings.sent1: The plan was enactable, so we decided to proceed with it.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were clear and enactable, making the task easy to complete.
meanings.sent3: The enactable idea of having a picnic in the living room made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her enactable determination to finish the race inspired others to push harder.
meanings.sent5: The enactable goal of climbing the mountain kept him motivated throughout the journey.

meanings.definition: Able to be enacted or made into law.
meanings.sent1: The proposed bill was enactable and received support from both parties.
meanings.sent2: The new policy was enactable and aimed to improve public safety.
meanings.sent3: The enactable suggestion to have dessert before dinner surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her enactable argument in court convinced the jury of her innocence.
meanings.sent5: The enactable regulation on recycling helped reduce waste in the community.
